Rules: The game of Red Light is a very simple jeopardy game in which two players race to reach 50 points. In a bag, 4 red and 24 green chips (\“lights\”) are shuffled. Each turn, a player repeatedly draws chips until either a \“red light\” is drawn or the player holds and scores the number of \“green lights\” drawn (i.e. the turn total). At any time during a player's turn, the player is faced with two decisions: 

Draw (\“Go\”) - If the player draws a 
	Red: the player scores nothing and it becomes the opponent's turn. If the red draw was the last remaining red, all chips are returned to the bag and are shuffled. 
	Green: the player adds 1 to their turn total and the player's turn continues. 

Hold (\“Stop\”) - The turn total is added to the player's score and it becomes the opponent's turn.


Players may also play this game with a standard deck of cards. The 4 Aces serve as red lights, while the 24 cards numbered 2 through 7 serve as green lights. In test mode, you can control the random events with your own cards/chips in order to demonstrate the fairness of computer play.
